Articles.Content:
12 minutes ago, Morphisor said:

That is honestly as good as you can expect given those specs. KSP isn't exactly lightweight on the hardware requirements when modding.

I mean im fine with that but its important for me cuz im making YT videos with it. And i need 60fps. Also what do i need to run KSP with mods NASAs super computer?

12 minutes ago, Gameslinx said:

The next BH update will support the most recent Parallax version which will improve your framerate by ~130%. It'll also make it optional 

Ow man i really dont want to rush you but please make it ASAP. Also i figured the problem is mainly Scatterer since without it im running around 50fps. And im also discussing the same thing on their forum.

2 minutes ago, BlackEyedPhantom said:

I mean im fine with that but its important for me cuz im making YT videos with it. And i need 60fps. Also what do i need to run KSP with mods NASAs super computer?

You could roll back to the Beyond Home version before the Parallax update (Version 1.4.2) https://github.com/Gameslinx/BeyondHomePlanetMod/releases/tag/1.4.2 

3 minutes ago, BlackEyedPhantom said:

Ow man i really dont want to rush you but please make it ASAP

Unfortunately this takes time and with my university course starting again on Monday I'm not going to have a lot of time on my hands

2 minutes ago, Gameslinx said:

You could roll back to the Beyond Home version before the Parallax update (Version 1.4.2) https://github.com/Gameslinx/BeyondHomePlanetMod/releases/tag/1.4.2 

Unfortunately this takes time and with my university course starting again on Monday I'm not going to have a lot of time on my hands

Ok so i dont think it will work even tho i install without parallax cuz even the stock game is like that with Scatterer and i dont have parallax installed on it.

 

And i do understand how hard it is to do "school" and work. I do understand that you care about what we (users of ur mod) think. Some dont and you aren't one of them. And i just wanna say keep it up. Ure doing great.

Found a murderous bug today. First time exploring Beyond Home and I love it. Slowly working my up, besides vanshing flags on Hydrus I havent found bugs until today.

I landed my trusted and proven lander on Vasto's lowlands. Did my science and moved Bob down the ladder and.... poof he died before I let go of the ladder. Bill came next, also poof. Reload quicksave, made a small hop a few 100 meters away. Again Bon comes down the ladder and goes poof. Jebediah also. Quit game, reload, same situation. Haven't gotten back into orbit yet, will try tomorrow.

the terrain in my game has like probly a 250X250 square area of black terrain wherever i go out of nowhere to ive been using this for awhile now. i uninstalled every mod i have re installed and had to go back a version of beyond home hoping it would fix it but no same issue im using stellar oddissey wich is supposed to support beyond home as of last weeks uppdate but i have no idea other then that small mods. i have the same issue with loading all stock parts as well so i have no clue
the console debug says error render distance texture height and width must be larger then 0

25 minutes ago, Aborted Yolk said:

the terrain in my game has like probly a 250X250 square area of black terrain wherever i go out of nowhere to ive been using this for awhile now. i uninstalled every mod i have re installed and had to go back a version of beyond home hoping it would fix it but no same issue im using stellar oddissey wich is supposed to support beyond home as of last weeks uppdate but i have no idea other then that small mods. i have the same issue with loading all stock parts as well so i have no clue

 

You need to install Parallax. Read the install instructions when installing planet mods

sorry for the late response i fell asleep but i did try to use parallax and for some reason rhode and only rhode experienced insane amounts of lag like 15 fps at the buildings screen and like 1-3 fps outside of vab or sph every planet but rhode is fine but rhode gets intense unusable lag i can try it again i have a gtx 1070 8gb ram on the card and 47.96 GB (thought it was 49 gigs but i checked) of ram total i7-7700K CPU 4.2 GHZ

sorry for the late response i fell asleep but i did try to use parallax and for some reason rhode and only rhode experienced insane amounts of lag like 15 fps at the buildings screen and like 1-3 fps outside of vab or sph every planet but rhode is fine but rhode gets intense unusable lag i can try it again i have a gtx 1070 8gb ram on the card and 47.96 GB (thought it was 49 gigs but i checked) of ram total i7-7700K CPU 4.2 GHZ 

I'm having the same problem as you, I also have a GTX1070 and the FPS is very low on planets with atmosphere, especially when launching, it's like PPT. Maybe I should delete EVE?
Where can i find Kopernicus 1.10.1 for this planetpack?

5 hours ago, VentosMentos said:

Where can i find Kopernicus 1.10.1 for this planetpack?

I guess you can check here, as the current official version for Kopernicus only supports until 1.9.1 AFAIK (although I may be wrong):

2 hours ago, JorgeCS said:

I guess you can check here, as the current official version for Kopernicus only supports until 1.9.1 AFAIK (although I may be wrong):

 

Both Kopernicus's are official, but the bleeding edge supports newer versions and features albeit in a "beta" state.

Mind you, many users find that beta state perfectly usable.  Most known bugs are listed in the release notes.

1.9.1-only release is best considered the "stable" branch, and is self-explanatory.

Edited January 18, 2021 by R-T-B

21 minutes ago, R-T-B said:

Both Kopernicus's are official, but the bleeding edge supports newer versions and features albeit in a "beta" state.

Mind you, many users find that beta state perfectly usable.  Most known bugs are listed in the release notes.

1.9.1-only release is best considered the "stable" branch, and is self-explanatory.

On 1/5/2021 at 10:35 PM, Clamp-o-Tron said:

https://github.com/R-T-B/Kopernicus/releases/tag/UBE-release-58

Try this- download the KopernicusBE_1110_Release58.zip, not the KopernicusBE_1101_Release58.zip.

Kopernicus technically isn't compatible with 1.10 and 1.11, but the beta is available with very few bugs.

Was also useful for me, thanks!
